table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: The Horizontal Flow Barrier package is used to simulate barriers to flow such as slurry walls by reducing the conductance between individual pairs of cells.

li.link: Harbaugh, A.W., Banta, E.R., Hill, M.C., and McDonald, M.G., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey modular ground-water model -- User guide to modularization concepts and the Ground-Water Flow Process: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-92, 121 p.

Hsieh, P.A., and Freckleton, J.R., 1993, Documentation of a computer program to simulate horizontal-flow barriers using the U.S. Geological Survey modular three- dimensional finite-difference ground-water flow model: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 92-477, 32 p.

Hanson, R.T., Boyce, S.E., Schmid, Wolfgang, Hughes, J.D., Mehl, S.M., Leake, S.A., Maddock, Thomas, III, and Niswonger, R.G., 2014, One-Water Hydrologic Flow Model (MODFLOW-OWHM): U.S. Geological Survey Techniques and Methods 6–A51, 120 p., http://dx.doi.org/10.3133/tm6A51.

para.text: sets the conductance between cells that is modified by the Horizontal Flow Barrier package.

li.text: capability is incompatible with the Horizontal Flow Barrier package.
The capability of routing flow between non-adjacent cells can only be used with the
solver and is only included in MODFLOW-OWHM.
For vertical barriers, the layers must be adjacent to one another.

para.text: The Horizontal Flow Barrier Package is documented in Hsieh and Freckleton (1993). Input for the Horizontal Flow Barrier (HFB) Package is read from the file that has file type “HFB6” in the
file. The file type has been changed from that used in MODFLOW-96, which was “HFB”, because the input data are not compatible. All variables are read in free format.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Item 0 is optional—“#” must be in column 1. Item 0 can be repeated multiple times.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text—is a character variable (199 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character must be in column 1. Except for the name file, lines beginning with # are restricted to these first lines of the file. Text is printed when the file is read.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NPHFB—is the number of horizontal-flow barrier parameters to be defined in Items 2 and 3. Note that for an HFB parameter to have an effect in the simulation, it must be defined in Items 2 and 3 and made active using Item 6
to have an effect in the simulation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MXFB—is the maximum number of HFB barriers that will be defined using parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NHFBNP—is the number of HFB barriers not defined by parameters

for current stress period. Item 4 will be read NHFBNP times as specified in item 1. If NHFBNP is set to -1 in item 7, then NACTHFB and items 8 and 9 are not read, and the barriers defined in the previous stress period are used. Item 8 will be read NHFBNP times as specified in item 7.
the maximum number of HFB barriers not defined by parameters used during any stress period. If MXHFBNP is not specified, it is set equal to NHFBNP in item 1.
MXHFBNP is only included in MODFLOW-OWHM.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Option—is an optional list of character values.
parameter. Items 2 and 3 are not read if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARNAM—is the name of a parameter. This name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. All parameter names must be unique.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARTYP—is the type of parameter. For the HFB Package, the only allowed parameter type is HFB, which defines values of the hydraulic characteristic of the barrier.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NLST—is the number of horizontal-flow barrier cells included in the parameter.
Layer IROW1 ICOL1 IROW2 ICOL2 Factor
NLST repetitions of Item 3 are required; they are read by module

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Factor—is the factor used to calculate hydraulic characteristic from the parameter value. The hydraulic characteristic is the product of Factor and the parameter value.

If final hydraulic characteristic is negative, then it acts as a multiplier to the conductance between the two model cells specified as containing a barrier. For example, if the final result was –1.5, it would multiply by 1.5 the conductance between the two cells.
Negative Factor values are only supported in MODFLOW-OWHM.
FOR FIRST STRESS PERIOD OR ALL STRESS PERIODS
Layer IROW1 ICOL1 IROW2 ICOL2 Hydchr
repetitions of Item 4 are read. Item 4 is not read if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Hydchr—is the hydraulic characteristic of the horizontal-flow barrier. The hydraulic characteristic is the barrier hydraulic conductivity divided by the width of the horizontal-flow barrier. If hydraulic characteristic is negative, then it acts as a multiplier to the conductance between the two model cells specified as containing a barrier. For example, if the final result was –1.5, it would multiply by 1.5 the conductance between the two cells.
Negative Hydchr values are only supported in MODFLOW-OWHM.
If IROW1=IROW2 and ICOL1=ICOL2 and ABS(Layer2- Layer)=1, then there is no flow routing, but instead the barrier is changed to a vertical barrier between layers and will work with any solver package.

para.text: NACTHFB—is the number of active HFB parameters.
repetitions of Item 6 are read. Item 6 is not read if

para.text: Pname—is the name of a parameter to be used in the simulation.
OPTIONAL: FOR EACH SUBSEQUENT STRESS PERIOD
Data Sets 7-9 are only included in MODFLOW-OWHM

If NACTHFB is set to –1, then NHFBNP and items 8 and 9 are not read. Instead the barriers defined in the previous stress period are used. If MXHFBP is 0, then NHFBNP is not read in since it cannot be larger than 0.
the number of active HFB parameters for the current stress period.
the number of HFB barriers not defined by parameters for current stress period. Item 4 will be read NHFBNP times as specified in item 1. If NHFBNP is set to -1 in item 7, then
and items 8 and 9 are not read, and the barriers defined in the previous stress period are used. Item 8 will be read NHFBNP times as specified in item 7.
, from item 7, repetitions of Item 8 are read. Item 8 is not read if
the name of a parameter to be used in the current stress period. NACTHFB parameter names will be read.
Layer IROW1 ICOL1 IROW2 ICOL2 Hydchr [Layer2]
, from item 7, repetitions of Item 9 are read. Item 9 is not read if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Hydchr—is the hydraulic characteristic of the horizontal-flow barrier. The hydraulic characteristic is the barrier hydraulic conductivity divided by the width of the horizontal-flow barrier. If hydraulic characteristic is negative, then it acts as a mulitplier to the conductance between the two model cells specified as containing a barrier. For example, if the final result was –1.5, it would multiply by 1.5 the conductance between the two cells.
